Package chessp

Class ChessP

java.lang.Object
chessp.ChessP
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public abstract class ChessP extends Object
Stores information about the chess piece and offers methods that operate on the chess piece
Author:
Parth Patel, Yash Patel

  • Constructor Details

    • ChessP

      public ChessP(boolean isWhite, int row, int col)
      Parameters:
      isWhite - Which team is this piece on?
      row - current row index on the board
      col - current column index on the board Initializes the chess piece information

  • Method Details

    • move

      public void move(int col, int row, boolean theoretical) throws Exception
      Parameters:
      col - destination column index on the board
      row - destination row index on the board
      theoretical - whether this move is a theoretical move or official move
      Throws:
      Exception - if the move is invalid moves the piece to the destination from its current location

    • undoMove

      public void undoMove()
      Undoes the last move of this piece

    • isValidLocation

      public boolean isValidLocation(int col, int row)
      Parameters:
      col - destination column index on the board
      row - destination row index on the board
      Returns:
      whether destination is valid for this piece

    • isOccupiedBySameColor

      public boolean isOccupiedBySameColor(int col, int row)
      Parameters:
      col - destination column index on the board
      row - destination row index on the board
      Returns:
      whether the destination is occupied by a teammate

    • preliminaryLegalMove

      public boolean preliminaryLegalMove(int col, int row)
      Parameters:
      col - destination column index on the board
      row - destination row index on the board
      Returns:
      whether destination is valid and is not occupied by a teammate and if the piece is following its own path

    • willMoveBlockCheck

      public boolean willMoveBlockCheck(int col, int row)
      Parameters:
      col - destination column index on the board
      row - destination row index on the board
      Returns:
      whether this move will block the check, if your king is in check

    • willMovePutKingInCheck

      public boolean willMovePutKingInCheck(int col, int row)
      Parameters:
      col - destination column index on the board
      row - destination row index on the board
      Returns:
      whether this move will put your king in check

    • canMoveHorizontally

      public boolean canMoveHorizontally(int col, int row)
      Parameters:
      col - destination column index on the board
      row - destination row index on the board
      Returns:
      whether this piece can move horizontally without obstruction This method is only used as part of a combination of other methods Ex. Queen can only move diagonally, vertically, or horizontally Ex. Bishop can only move diagonally

    • canMoveVertically

      public boolean canMoveVertically(int col, int row)
      Parameters:
      col - destination column index on the board
      row - destination row index on the board
      Returns:
      whether this piece can move vertically without obstruction This method is only used as part of a combination of other methods Ex. Queen can only move diagonally, vertically, or horizontally Ex. Bishop can only move diagonally

    • canMoveDiagonally

      public boolean canMoveDiagonally(int col, int row)
      Parameters:
      col - destination column index on the board
      row - destination row index on the board
      Returns:
      whether this piece can move diagonally without obstruction This method is only used as part of a combination of other methods Ex. Queen can only move diagonally, vertically, or horizontally Ex. Bishop can only move diagonally

    • kingInCheckHorizontally

      public boolean kingInCheckHorizontally(King OpponentKing)
      Parameters:
      OpponentKing - reference to the opponent king
      Returns:
      whether this piece checks the opponent king horizontally

      OpponentKing - reference to the opponent king
      Returns:
      whether this piece checks the opponent king vertically

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      whether this piece checks the opponent king diagonally

    • kingInCheckByPossibleMoves

      public boolean kingInCheckByPossibleMoves(King OpponentKing, int[] possibleXMoves, int[] possibleYMoves)
      Parameters:
      OpponentKing - reference to the opponent king
      possibleXMoves - integer array of possible X moves that this piece can take
      possibleYMoves - integer array of possible Y moves that this piece can take
      Returns:
      whether this piece checks the opponent king
